programme.title: Jamie's 30 Minute Meals
programme.desc: Too busy? Too expensive? Don't know how? We've all made excuses for grabbing junk food or bunging a ready meal in the oven. But Jamie Oliver thinks everyone deserves to eat delicious, nutritious food, and in his new series Jamie shows how to create a whole home-cooked feast from scratch in the time it takes to heat up a ready meal. This fast-paced show demonstrates in real time how to create a whole meal, featuring a substantial main course with delicious sides and salads, gorgeous puddings and refreshing drinks. Whether you're a beginner looking for step-by-step instructions, or an experienced cook looking to breathe new life into your repertoire, the series has the answers

programme.title: The Sixties
programme.desc: Major events and milestones of the 1960s are explored in this documentary series. The premiere features a look at the changing landscape of television, including "The Twilight Zone," "The Fugitive" and "I Dream of Jeannie." Remarks by: Tom Hanks; Sally Field; Dick and Tom Smothers; Carol Burnett; Dick Cavett; Diahann Carroll; Carl Reiner; Vince Gilligan; and Petula Clark

programme.title: The Sixties
programme.desc: The influence of British rock bands on American music in the 1960s is discussed. Remarks by: Graham Nash; Smokey Robinson; Dave Clark; Michelle Phillips; Mickey Dolenz; Jann Wenner; Nelson George; David Wild; Tom Hanks; and Mikal Gilmore

programme.title: The Sixties
programme.desc: American culture of the 1960s is explored. Remarks by: Jann Wenner, Grace Slick, David Wild, Leonard Steinhorn, Tom Wolfe, Douglas Brinkley and Tom Hanks

programme.title: The Sixties
programme.desc: The decade that shaped America. A look back at the tense political situations that arose in the 60s, from the Cuban missile crisis to the Bay of Pigs Invasion

programme.title: The Sixties
programme.desc: A look at the assassination of John F. Kennedy, including an examination of the 1964 Warren report and interviews with eyewitnesses. Remarks by: historians Robert Dallek and Robert Caro; journalists Robert MacNeil and Dan Rather; and Alexandra Zapruder, whose grandfather famously captured the assassination on film

programme.title: The Sixties
programme.desc: The Vietnam War is discussed, including a look at Lyndon B. Johnson and the Gulf of Tonkin. Remarks by: Tim O'Brien; Frederik Logevall; Karl Marlantes; Neil Sheehan; Andrew Bacevich; George Herring; Tom Hayden; and Philip Caputo(n)

programme.title: The Sixties
programme.desc: Dramatic events of 1968 are recalled, including the Soviet incursion into Czechoslovakia, assassinations, developments in the Southeast Asia wars, the end of the Johnson administration, violence at the Democratic National Convention and Nixon's election. Remarks by: Tom Hayden; Gloria Steinem; Lance Morrow; Evan Thomas; Dan Rather; Morley Safer; Tim Naftali; and Mark Kurlansky(n)

programme.title: The Sixties
programme.desc: Key moments in the civil-rights movement are recalled, including the March on Washington, lunch counter sit-ins, Freedom Rides, Freedom Summer, integration and the Children's Crusade. Remarks by: Diane Nash; Rep. John Lewis (D-Ga.); Rep. Eleanor Holmes Norton (D-D.C.); Rev. C.T. Vivian; Bob Moses; Diane McWhorter; Taylor Branch; David Garrow; and Isabel Wilkerson(n)

programme.title: The Sixties
programme.desc: Space exploration in the 1960s is discussed. Remarks by: NASA administrator Charles Bolden; astronauts Mike Massimino and Dave Scott; Tom Hanks; Aspen Institute president Walter Isaacson; historian Douglas Brinkley; author Tom Wolfe; and science journalist Andy Chaikin(n)

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, `Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia

The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, `Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia

programme.title: The Young and the Restless
programme.desc: An iconic, enduring soap opera, this is the steamer set in Genoa City, where the Newman and Abbott dynasties stir it up in the bedroom and the boardroom. Best known for long-term love triangles, issue-oriented plots, a multi-ethnic cast and slick production values, `Y&R' has been showered with Emmys, launched countless careers and spawned the equally lavish `The Bold and the Beautiful.' Former cast members include Tom Selleck and David Hasselhoff

programme.title: The Bold and the Beautiful
programme.desc: The high-glam soap about L.A.'s fashionable and fertile Forrester clan was designed as a sister soap to the popular 'The Young and the Restless,' and quickly won ratings and global fans with cast crossovers, exotic remotes, glossy runaway shows and fast-paced storylines about beautiful people behaving badly. In 2004, the show introduced a new family, the Marones, and recruited several nighttime alums to beef up the cast. And to create a little chaos

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia

programme.desc: Along with her best friend, American teenager Mia Thermopolis (Anne Hathaway) travels to Genovia after their high-school graduation to take up her duties as a princess. But her life is turned upside down when she not only learns that she is to take the crown as queen earlier than expected, but that she is also to be married before this event. Queen Clarice asks that Mia be allowed time to find a husband, and she is given 30 days. However, greedy Viscount Mabrey will try to do what he can to stop that. He wasn't counting on the fact that his nephew has met Mia and they are both attracted to each other'(n)

programme.title: Bad Santa (2003)
programme.desc: A hilariously criminal Santa finds a measure of holiday redemption when he befriends a troubled kid. The traditional Christmas tale will never be the same after this cleverly twisted, merrily irreverent story of a Santa so bad that he's funny. Billy Bob Thornton stars (in a Golden Globe-nominated role) as Willie T. Stokes, a washed-up, wisecracking department store Santa who is only in the business for the criminal opportunities. Every Christmas Eve this Santa and his ingenious Elf' Willie's midget partner-in-crime Marcus (Tony Cox), crack the store safe and make off with their own holiday stash. But this year Santa and his Elf find their annual heist endangered by a pesky store manager (John Ritter), a savvy mall detective (Bernie Mac), a sexy Santa fan (Lauren Graham) and an 8-year-old misfit (Brett Kelly) who decides to believe that Willie: intoxicated, acid-tongued and felonious as he is, is the real Santa(n)

But Gru knows that his nemesis has a mean sweet tooth, and plans to destroy him by adopting three cookie-selling orphans and commissioning a new line of cookie robots from the evil Dr. Nefario. So there's competition to rush to the rescue when mad scientist Romero, who lives on an island peopled by genetically mutated animals, invents a transmooker device which can shut off all the electricity on Earth. programme.title: The Incredibles (2004)
programme.desc: Bob Parr (aka Mr. Incredible) used to be a superhero, but now he lives just like any other human being after a surge of lawsuits against superheroes forced the government to hide them in witness protection programs. Known exclusively by his new identity, Bob lives with his wife Helen, formerly known as Elastigirl, and their three children Violet, Dash, and Jack Jack. He works as an insurance claims specialist, and is fed up with his pushy boss and his immoral profession. Just when it looks as if things can't get any worse for Bob, he gets a summons to show up at a remote island to receive instructions for a highly classified assignment. Thrust back into the world of fighting crime, the Incredible family is back in familiar territory(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel considers inviting her sexy young assistant, Tag, to Monica's Thanksgiving dinner. Much to her delight Tag has just broken up with his long-term girlfriend, but she is afraid to violate company policy. Meanwhile, Phoebe reveals that she has been secretly keeping a cute dog in her room for a few days while its owner is away, but to the others' amusement, Chandler admits that he is afraid of dogs

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Special guest star Brad Pitt plays Will, Monica's high-school friend who was the only student fatter than she was. She invites him to Thanksgiving dinner with the gang, unaware that he isn't exactly fond of Rachel (Jennifer Aniston was married to Pitt at the time). Meanwhile, Chandler and Phoebe pretend to be mesmerised by the American football to avoid helping Monica in the kitchen. And Joey vows to devour the entire turkey single-handedly

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: On the night before Thanksgiving, Rachel's self-centred younger sister, Amy, ruins everyone's holiday dinner with her uncensored observations. Amy is upset to learn that Rachel would not want her to care for her baby if she and Ross were to die. Chandler is also offended that he is not considered the best adoptive parent. Meanwhile, Monica obsessively protects her good wedding china, and Joey forgets to join his television cast mates in the big Thanksgiving parade

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica reluctantly agrees to cook Thanksgiving dinner, but locks everyone out when they turn up late - Joey and Ross went to a Rangers game while Rachel and Phoebe took Emma to a baby beauty contest. And then Monica gets some adoption news..

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: On Thanksgiving, the friends form teams and play American football. Ross and Monica relive their sibling rivalry by going head-to-head as opposing team captains. Rachel is upset that Ross didn't choose her for his team, and Joey tries to outwit his foe Chandler. Meanwhile, the turkey is left stewing while the losing team calls for a rematch

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The friends have a Thanksgiving meal together. Monica is reminded of Richard when she tries to kiss his son, Timothy, and Joey frees Chandler from the box he's being kept in to stop Kathy leaving him

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The gang reflects on bad Thanksgivings---and the biggest turkey belongs to Monica, who recalls her first encounter with Chandler (Matthew Perry). Nora: Morgan Fairchild. Young Chandler: Joshua Preston

programme.desc: George's search for his father may end when he meets a former plant worker (Cheech Marin) who had a drunken fling with Benny (Belita Moreno). Charles: John Michael Higgins. Ernie: Valente Rodriguez. Angie: Constance Marie

programme.desc: SpongeBob is a sea sponge who lives with his pet snail, Gary, in a fully furnished, two bedroom pineapple in the town of Bikini Bottom. SpongeBob's dream in life is to be the ocean's ultimate fry cook, and thanks to his job flipping Krabby Patties at the Krusty Krab, he lives that dream every day. SpongeBob is as optimistic and earnest as a sea-dwelling sponge gets, but he can't seem to avoid getting himself, and usually everyone else around him, into trouble. SpongeBob is as optimistic and earnest as a sea-dwelling sponge gets, but he can't seem to avoid getting himself, and usually everyone else around him, into trouble. While trying too hard, he tends to do things wrong...really wrong...which usually spells "disaster." programme.title: Coming to America (1988)
programme.desc: One of the more enjoyable films from Eddie Murphy's 80s output, this modern-day fairy tale sees the star cast as a wealthy and pampered African prince who heads to America in search of a bride. He and his friend, Semmi arrive in Queens, New York City, because according to Akeem: 'What better place to find a queen than the city of Queens?'. The prince quickly finds a job, new friends, new digs, new enemies, and more trouble than he ever bargained for. Under John Landis's assured direction, Murphy turns in a star performance (alongside several brilliant cameos) that is disciplined and, most importantly, very, very funny

programme.title: Trading Places (1983)
programme.desc: (1983) Dan Aykroyd plays Louis Winthorpe III, a rich, smug investment broker set up by brothers Randolph and Mortimer Duke (Ralph Bellamy and Don Ameche) in their experiment to prove that environment counts for more than breeding. Stripped of his home, money, fiancée and job, he sees the homeless Billy Ray Valentine (Eddie Murphy) take his place instead. The only person interested in helping Winthorpe is hooker Ophelia (Jamie Lee Curtis). But when the three discover Randolph and Duke's plot, they plan to get even (and rich) in John Landis's landmark, rip-roaring comedy. M,R,,HD

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy visits a classic diner in Bakersfield, Cal., where he eats meaty Texas chili and decadent pumpkin pancakes; and discovers a hidden gem dishing out peanut-butter burgers and homemade bacon ice cream. Also: a gourmet taco spot in Phoenix known for its mole

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: No knife and fork are required to eat the foods featured on this trip. programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy travels west for barbecue. Included: homemade chorizo and a Yucatan turkey special served at a food court gem in Los Angeles. Also: two funky grill joints in Las Vegas

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Comfort food is in the spotlight when Guy visits an Atlanta joint known for its chicken and biscuits and house-cured lox; and twin brothers serve Southern grub, including a brisket burger and chicken-fried ribs. Also: vegetarian specialties from a café in Fort Collins, Colo

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy finds a slice of history all over the country. In Santa Barbara, California, the neighborhood deli is a favorite with locals and celebrities alike for its pastrami served all kinds of ways, like the pastrami dog. In Dallas, Texas, a Mexican native pays homage to his restaurateur father by serving up authentic recipes from his family's cookbook, like the albondiga soup. And in Minneapolis, Minnesota, the family-run Italian deli has been scratch making its pizzas and pastas since the '80s, with favorites like the fettucini bolognese and risotto cakes with creamy gorgonzola sauce

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: This trip, Guy goes all animal. In Charleston, South Carolina, the husband and wife duo flying high for all things bird, like a duck club with homemade garlic mayo. In Queens, New York, a Cuban family crankin' out totally traditional steak and chicken dishes, like ropa vieja and arroz con pollo. And in Vancouver, British Columbia, the bar turned sausage joint stuffing, casing, and serving up links like the Thai chicken sausage

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives

programme.title: The Dark Ages
programme.desc: Examining Europe's grim six-century-long period marked by famine, plague, persecutions and a persistent state of war that began with the fall of Rome in the fifth century A.D., and ended with the first Crusade. Also explored are the period's political and cultural ideas that would shape Europe in the future(c)

programme.title: Modern Marvels

programme.title: Modern Marvels
programme.desc: Items considered obsolete, such as typewriters, VCRs, analog TVs, film cameras and albums, are examined. programme.title: 101 Inventions That Changed the World
programme.desc: Toda idea comienza con una chispa, pero algunas crecen y logran cambiar al mundo. La necesidad es la madre de la invención. Desde la oscuridad el hombre busca la luz y comienza usando una simple vela; de un lugar alguien quiere comunicarse a la distancia y nace la idea del teléfono. Pero algunos inventos transformaron la vida más allá de nuestros hogares: la máquina a vapor, el telescopio, y el internet todo cambia nuestra vida. En esta cuenta regresiva veremos como la inventiva llega de todas formas y maneras. Algunos nacieron con un sencillo uso, como el martillo, mientras que otros desafiaron los límites que no creían posibles, como el avión. Pero sin importar el porcentaje de inspiración o transpiración por cada invento, nos han cambiado la vida para siempre(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day (1993)
programme.desc: Sent once more to Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, to cover the annual Groundhog Day festival, television weatherman Phil Connors finds himself stuck in time, endlessly repeating February 2nd. Trying to make the best of his absurd situation, Phil becomes both master and victim of his peculiar predicament. With no tomorrow to worry about and plenty of time on his hands, Phil gets to explore some of his favourite fantasies, becomes an expert at all things trivial and pointless, gets lucky with the local girls and continually strikes out with the real love of his life. Reduced to a shadow of his former self, Phil finally makes the discovery that transforms him, enabling him to climb out of the longest day in comic history

In 480 BC, the ambitious King Xerxes of Persia plans to invade Greece with his massive army to extend his slave empire. But the brave King Leonidas intervenes demanding that his 300 Spartan warriors block the only way by land to reach Greece, engaging them in a narrow canyon where they cannot take full advantage of their number. programme.title: The Departed (2006)
programme.desc: After six Oscar-nominations, Martin Scorsese finally picked up the statuette for this stunning, gripping crime thriller, based on the equally superb Hong Kong original Infernal Affairs . Matt Damon plays Colin Sullivan, the protégé of Boston gangster Frank Costello who has been groomed through police academy to become Frank's ears and eyes in the police department. Leonardo DiCaprio plays Billy Costigan, a cop deliberately disgraced so he can infiltrate Costello's gang to get enough information to bring him down. But Costello begins to smell a rat and demands Sullivan get him the name of the insider while Costigan realises the net may be closing in before he can get the information he needs. Superb performances from the three leads, with Nicholson reined in by Scorsese, supplemented by Oscar-nominee Mark Wahlberg as the foul-mouthed Sgt Dignam and Martin Sheen as Captain Queenan, Costigan's handlers who Sullivan must get past to find out his identity

programme.desc: (2000) Bryan Singer's fantasy film is set on a parallel Earth where humans reluctantly live alongside mutants, those with genetic "defects" that give them superhuman powers. The mutants are gathered into two camps. Those at Professor Charles Xavier's (Patrick Stewart) school are taught to curb their powers and use them for good, while his opposite number, Magneto (Ian McKellen), believes that humans want to destroy them and is assembling a force to win the day by turning the world's leaders into mutants. The film concentrates on Wolverine and Rogue (Hugh Jackman, Anna Paquin), who side with Xavier as the two factions launch into climactic battle. Edited for language and violence ; HD Wide(n)

He becomes Nacho and, with his tag partner Esqueleto aka The Skeleton (Héctor Jiménez), begins to fight his way to the top and take a crack at the arrogant Ramses (Cesar Gonzalez). programme.title: What If (2013)
programme.desc: A cynical med-school dropout who has been burned by love hits it off with an aspiring animator in a committed relationship. They quickly become friends, but must contend with the reality that they mean much more to each other than that

programme.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer & Uncut (1999)
programme.desc: Feature-length outing for the TV adult cartoon comedy series about an American town where bizarre events are an everyday occurrence. After seeing a new film that they are too young to view, the South Park kids start swearing uncontrollably. This leads to their parents starting an anti-censorship campaign - which, in turn, precipitates armed conflict between the USA and Canada

programme.title: Snowpiercer (2013)
programme.desc: A revolution brews on a train containing the last of humanity in this sci-fi film set during a new ice age. When the lower classes in the back cars decide to invade the upper classes in the front, the superpowered locomotive speeds toward tragedy

programme.title: Apartment Troubles (2014)
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals flee their money troubles in New York for what they hope will be a stress-free vacation in Los Angeles. However, they soon realize their trip will be anything but relaxing when they move in with an eccentric aunt

programme.title: Meet Joe Black (1998)
programme.desc: The Grim Reaper comes to Earth to retrieve a media tycoon shortly before his 65th birthday, but agrees to grant him a little more time if the mogul will teach him about life's pleasures. The doomed man jumps at the chance, but doesn't foresee that Death will fall in love with his beautiful daughter

programme.title: Play It Forward (2015)
programme.desc: The emotional and candid story of NFL legend Tony Gonzalez and his brother Chris

programme.title: St. Vincent (2014)
programme.desc: A single mother with a 12 year-old son has no choice but to leave him in the care of their neighbour, a retired curmudgeon with a penchant for swearing, drinking, and gambling. Strangely, however, the two become unlikely friends

programme.title: 5 to 7 (2014)
programme.desc: A writer falls for a French diplomat's wife, whose unorthodox rules limit their affair to between the hours of 5 and 7pm. Unhappy with her time constraints, he must decide if the relationship is worth continuing

programme.title: Calendar Girls (2003)
programme.desc: Chris (Helen Mirren) and Annie (Julie Walters) are two very different women who live in a small village in the Yorkshire Dales. Their friendship is put to the test just when their relationship needs to be stronger than ever. When Annie's husband dies of leukemia, Chris organizes a campaign to raise funds for the local hospital. Her plan is to produce a calendar featuring photographs of the village women performing their traditional tasks. But the proposal has an original twist: the women will pose in the nude. The pictures are known all across the country and the women become famous

programme.title: Bernie (2011)
programme.desc: Texas mortician Bernie Tiede becomes a suspect in the murder of reviled widow Marjorie Nugent after their friendship sours and her body is discovered stuffed in a freezer. But things take a strange turn when the community rallies to Bernie's defense

programme.title: Pulp Fiction (1994)
programme.desc: Jules Winnfield and Vincent Vega are two hitmen who are out to retrieve a suitcase stolen from their employer, mob boss Marsellus Wallace. Wallace has also asked Vincent to take his wife Mia out a few days later when Wallace himself will be out of town. Butch Coolidge is an aging boxer who is paid by Wallace to lose his next fight. The lives of these seemingly unrelated people are woven together comprising of a series of funny, bizarre and uncalled-for incidents

programme.title: Penn & Teller: Bull
programme.desc: There's no kung-fooling around when the guys take a swing at martial arts

programme.title: Into the Blue (2005)
programme.desc: Good-looking but shallow thriller about divers (Paul Walker, Jessica Alba) battling sharks and criminals after discovering treasure and a crashed plane loaded with drugs. Scott Caan, Ashley Scott, Josh Brolin. Directed by John Stockwell

programme.title: Nacho Libre (2006)
programme.desc: Jared Hess's comedy stars Jack Black as Brother Ignacio, a monk in a destitute Mexican monastery who is distressed by the poor food he must cook for the orphans. He decides the only way to make money to feed them properly is to become a lucha libre wrestler (the immensely popular Mexican "sport" where masked wrestlers battle it out for fame and fortune). He becomes Nacho and, with his tag partner Esqueleto aka The Skeleton (Héctor Jiménez), begins to fight his way to the top and take a crack at the arrogant Ramses (Cesar Gonzalez). Ana de la Reguera plays Sister Encarnación, after whom Ignacio lusts in a platonic way, but the bulk of the film largely concerns men in tights and their frantic efforts in the ring

programme.title: Kobe Bryant's Muse (2015)
programme.desc: An in-depth look at the on and off-court life of the 16-time NBA All-Star, who has helped the Lakers win five championships. Included: the mentors, allies and rivalries that have shaped his career, and his thoughts on what lies ahead

programme.title: World Trade Center (2006)
programme.desc: The events of September 11 left an indelible mark on the lives of most Americans, particularly those in the New York City area. Yet as fresh as the images seem, it's easy to forget the actual grit, sacrifice, and uncertainty of that day. Director Oliver Stone captures the essence of 9/11 by focusing on the true story of two Port Authority Police Department officers who were trapped beneath the wreckage of the fallen World Trade Center

programme.title: The Scorpion King (2002)
programme.desc: In an ancient time, predating the pyramids, the evil king Memnon is using the psychic powers of his sorceress Cassandra to foretell his great victories. But Mathayus ends up getting much more than he bargained for. programme.title: Rocky (1976)
programme.desc: Uplifting, Oscar-winning drama about a small-time boxer from Philadelphia who - against all odds - gets a shot at his ultimate dream, the heavyweight championship of the world. The near-penniless Sylvester Stallone resisted various offers for his script, holding out for the title role himself. The film eventually won Academy Awards for Best Picture, Director and Editing, and spawned four sequels(n)

programme.title: Rocky II (1979)
programme.desc: Sequel to the 1976 Oscar-winning favourite which catapulted Sylvester Stallone to megastardom. Things are looking grim for Philadelphia boxer Rocky Balboa. His wife is in a post-natal coma and he has an eye injury that could cost him his sight. But heavyweight champion Apollo Creed's pride is still smarting from their first bout, and he wants a rematch with the Italian Stallion(n)

programme.title: Rocky III (1982)
programme.desc: After suffering a humiliating defeat at the hands of hungry young boxer Clubber Lang, Rocky is rejuvenated by his former rival Apollo Creed, who trains Rocky for a rematch against the fearsome mohawked rival, and helps him regain "the eye of the tiger."(n)

programme.title: Rocky IV (1985)
programme.desc: Another sequel, this time with legendary boxer Rocky Balboa set against the might of a superhuman Soviet fighting machine who has caused the death of his best friend. In taking the fight and Uncle Sam's best wishes to the heart of Russia, Rocky becomes an American icon, relishing the chance to dish out his own particular brand of justice(n)

programme.title: Gladiator (2000)
programme.desc: Winner of five Academy Awards, Gladiator revived the sword and sandal epic while becoming one of the acclaimed and popular historical dramas of the decade! Russell Crowe won an Oscar for his star-making turn as a general whose family is murdered by a corrupt prince (Academy Award-nominee Joaquin Phoenix). He embarks on a desperate quest for revenge that sees him fighting in front of thousands of Romans in the Coliseum. Directed by acclaimed filmmaker Ridley Scott, Gladiator re-creates the glory of Ancient Rome with Academy Award-winning special effects. A modern classic. Starring Russell Crowe Joaquin Phoenix, Richard Harris, Connie Nielsen and Oliver Reed(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen (2009)
programme.desc: Sam Witwicky wants his life back. After saving the universe of destruction in a battle between two warring races of robotic aliens, he wants to study at the University and spend the last moments before leaving with his girlfriend Mikaela. But avoiding his fate is not going to be an easy task to fulfill because an ambitious man of the government will put the world again in danger and start another round of the war between good and evil. The visions will return to Sams brain and he is not going to be able to ignore them. Despite he did not really want to, he finds himself back with his friends in the middle of a battle between the Autobots and Decepticons, and with the future of the whole universe in his hands(n)

programme.title: Father of the Bride Part II (1995)
programme.desc: A sequel to "Father of the Bride", the film revolves around George Banks who has to deal not only with the pregnancy of his daughter, but also with that of his wife(n)

programme.title: Definitely, Maybe (2008)
programme.desc: A political consultant in the midst of a bitter divorce attempts to delicately divulge the truth about his past relationships to his curious young daughter, who simply won't stop asking questions until she's satisfied with all the answers(n)

programme.title: Ghosts of Girlfriends Past (2009)
programme.desc: Successful fashion photographer and confirmed womanizer Connor Mead (Matthew McConaughey) has learned everything he knows about women from his deceased uncle Wayne (Michael Douglas). As his brother is about to get married, Connor takes a break from his playboy lifestyle to attend the ceremony not without first trying to convince his sibling of the enormous mistake he is about to make. After a drunken speech at the rehearsal dinner, Connor meets in the bathroom the ghost of Uncle Wayne, who surprisingly shows his regret and tells his nephew that, over the course of the evening, he'll be visited by three ghosts who will lead him through his romantic past, present, and future. Will this be Connor¿s big chance to get over himself and find true love?(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A Spanish club promoter is stabbed to death in his apartment, but Mac isn't convinced that the man was murdered. The case is made more difficult when the head of Barcelona's crime lab arrives to investigate and Mac learns the CSI is related to the victim

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A tractor-trailer carrying a group of party guests crashes into the Hudson River and several of the invitees drown. The evidence suggests it wasn't an accident but rather premeditated murder, so the CSIs search for a common link between the victims

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A triple-shooting in a nightclub sends the CSIs on the hunt for a professional killer. The case takes on added urgency when Hawkes learns that his childhood friend was kidnapped during the incident. Featuring singer Ne-Yo in a starring role

programme.title: CSI: NY

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: The sisters take in a lizard-like demon child after vanquishing its mother and debate over whether to destroy it too, but another magical entity (Seth Peterson) intervenes and attempts to take the youngster away from them. Meanwhile, Phoebe's empathic powers lead to a slip of the tongue that jeopardizes her relationship with Jason (Eric Dane)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Chris is attacked by a woman (Marisol Nichols) he dated in his own time, who then tries to steal the whitelighter's powers and bring him back to the future with her. Meanwhile, Paige tries to tell her sisters that she wants to move out of the mansion. Reggae singer Ziggy Marley performs. Richard: Balthazar Getty. Jason: Eric Dane. Chris: Drew Fuller

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Paige is transported back to 1967 where she meets Grams as a young woman, but neither of them know that a planned witch gathering is really a trap set by a demon. Meanwhile, in the present, a slimy demon torments the residents of Halliwell manor. Grams: Jennifer Rhodes. Chris: Drew Fuller

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: Sam and Dean investigate a town that's plagued by killer insects and discover that the area's new housing development is being built on sacred Native American land

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: The brothers head to their childhood home in Kansas after Sam has a premonition that the family now living there is in danger of being attacked by a paranormal entity. Psychic: Loretta Devine

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: The brothers investigate an abandoned sanitarium and learn that when it was operational, patients held a revolt against the head doctor, who inflicted cruel and unusual punishments. Tortured spirits drive the brothers insane, and Dean turns against Sam

programme.title: The Book of Eli (2009)
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic action about a solitary warrior who fights to protect the last known copy of a powerful book. Decades after a nuclear war, a lone man calling himself Eli trudges through the dilapidated cities and scorched wilderness of America, carrying his copy of the Bible, a sacred book that provides 'contentment for the weak-minded'. On an odyssey to bring the text to a sacred place, Eli brings God's wrath down on the robbers, murderers and rapists who lie in wait along the highways. Driven by faith and divine calling, Eli's endeavour becomes harder when he meets the power-hungry Carnegie, who tutors an army of psychopathic rogues and gunmen in a small town. Hoping to steal the book he believes is his last chance to rule what is left of humanity, Carnegie sets out to catch Eli, while Carnegie's step-daughter also follows Eli on his quest. As Carnegie and his henchmen hunt Eli down, they soon discover what a powerful and fearsome adversary he really is

programme.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey (2012)
programme.desc: Bilbo Baggins, Gandalf the wizard and a group of dwarves seek a dragon's treasure, and encounter a series of incredible obstacles over the course of their epic journey

programme.title: Clash of the Titans (2010)
programme.desc: In this fantasy adventure based on Greek mythology, a courageous warrior named Perseus vows to defeat Hades in order to prevent the god of the underworld from overthrowing Zeus, thereby turning Earth into a living hell. A man of godly origins, Perseus watched in agony as Hades took his family, but now, with a small band of warriors by his side, he battles mythical creatures while tapping into his god-like abilities to take control of his own fate

programme.title: Red (2010)
programme.desc: Bruce Willis, Helen Mirren, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich and Brian Cox star in this comedy action-thriller from director Robert Schwentke. Frank Moses quickly becomes all too familiar with the acronym RED - Retired, Extremely Dangerous - when his former CIA bosses send a crack squad to kill their best-ever hitman. But the extremely dangerous retiree proves more than a match for them. Realising the Agency won't give up so easily, he goes on the run and abducts, for her own safety, Sarah Ross, the pension worker he's fallen in love with over the phone. Still in the dark as to exactly why his country wants him dead, Moses sets out to find out, gathering around him a group of equally ageing-but-deadly friends and associates. Can the wily old foxes evade, overcome and/ or outgun the crème de la crème of a new generation's black ops people, led by William Cooper, to discover the truth? What follows is a non-stop onslaught of witty one-liners, gunshots and explosions... and a masterclass in knowing acting(n)

programme.title: Wanted (2008)
programme.desc: (2008) Angelina Jolie, James McAvoy and Morgan Freeman star in this violent action adventure from Russian director Timur Bekmambetov (Nightwatch, Daywatch). The life of office worker Wesley Gibson (McAvoy) has been one of frustration, disappointment and anxiety; he has an overbearing boss, his girlfriend and his best friend are duplicitously having an affair, and he's on medication to calm his nerves. To top it all, he one day finds himself on the wrong end of an assassination attempt. Luckily, the agile, honed and lethal Fox (Jolie) is at hand to save his life. However, she also reveals that his recently deceased father was secretly a supremely skilled killer, and that it's her job to ensure that Wesley takes his place in the Fraternity, the mystical organisation overseen by Sloan (Freeman), which exists to rid the world of evil-doers. And so begins Wesley's journey to unlock his hitherto unsuspected innate deadly abilities and use them for good. The cinematography echoes the inventiveness of Bekmambetov's earlier movies and takes a Matrix-like delight in playing with the tempo and camera angles of the fight scenes(n)

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: Hidden camera show where four friends - Joel Dommet, Roisin Conaty, Paul McCaffrey and Marek Larwood - compete to embarrass each another in everyday situations. Pushing each other to the limit, they take it in turns to complete embarrassing challenges. They have got to do or say everything the other jokers tell them via a hidden earpiece, but if they refuse they lose and face a humiliating forfeit. It's a ruthless fight to finish where there are no winners, just a loser. The jokers cause havoc when they take over a bakery, risk a punch in the face as they secretly try to touch strangers with just their noses, clear the streets with an obscene megaphone they can't control and kiss strangers' toes when they work at a foot spa

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.desc: Phil hopes his new RV will be the perfect vehicle for a family road trip, but Claire lets her husband find out for himself why it might not be such a good idea. programme.title: The Golden Compass (2007)
programme.desc: Based on the first volume in Philip Pullman's best-selling, award-winning trilogy, His Dark Materials, THE GOLDEN COMPASS unfolds an epic fantasy adventure set in a parallel world, where science and magic intertwine. Twelve-year-old Lyra Belacqua (played by newcomer Dakota Blue Richards) sets out to rescue her best friend, and ends up on an extraordinary quest to save not only her own world, but ours and others as well. Academy Award winner Nicole Kidman and stars with Daniel Craig in this triumph of the imagination. Filled with fascination, depth and wonder, Pullman's saga presents the eternal struggle of good vs. evil -- and the power of one young girl heal a rift torn in the fabric of the universe

programme.title: The Mechanic (2011)
programme.desc: Arthur Bishop (Jason Statham) is an elite assassin with a unique talent for making any job seem like natural causes or an accident if necessary. His job requires professional perfection and total detachment, and Bishop is the best in the business. But when his mentor and close friend Harry (Donald Sutherland) is murdered his world goes upside down. Harry's son Steve approaches him with a vengeful goal and a determination to learn Bishop's trade. Bishop has always acted alone but he can't turn his back on Harry's son, who becomes his apprentice. Things change though when Arthur learns that the circumstances surrounding Harry's hit is not what he was told
